title: [K-12] Reflective Practitioner-Centered Instructional Support Design for Online Science Assessment Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science assessment theory and experience with online learning platforms
context.additional_context: A course for undergraduate science education majors to develop competencies in designing and analyzing elementary science assessment tools.

learning_goals: Learners can use metacognitive strategies (learning journaling, goal setting, self-assessment) to establish a 3-tier self-directed learning plan (weekly goals, daily checklists, feedback incorporation) while completing ≥80% of the plan over 2 weeks when performing online science assessments (e.g., virtual lab reports).

Learners can utilize instructional support tools (3 guided prompts, feedback system, reflective journal template) in a blended environment to derive improvements for 2 existing assessment design processes within 2 weeks and produce a report meeting ≥4 points (80%) on a 5-point peer evaluation rubric.
Learners develop the ability to reconstruct assessment criteria by analyzing interaction records with peers and instructors
Learners interpret learning data collected through digital platforms to propose personalized assessment strategy adjustments
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
